Reviews.Title: “I've wouldn't recommend it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kris K
Reviews.Content: Reception staff wasn't friendly or helpful, they just give us the key and didn't inform us about breakfast or anything else Then when we asked for internet access they want me to pay for it even when that was included in the room price!!! Room was quite small but in really good order,although window view was poor. Air condition didn't work either so was so hot that we could't sleep. Breakfast area very small for many guest's so we have to wait every morning for a free table

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Elke_RVienna
Reviews.Content: The front-office staff is unbelievable rude! When we entered the hotel for check in the receptionist was talking to the other person. He told us ''wait please'' without even saying hello. Later he refused to help with the advice ! concerning rent a car in Rome. The breakfast ,room was very poor. We did not receive any hospitality at all. Avoid!

Reviews.Title: “Rome best kept secret....”
Reviews.Author: sevalex
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel, (previously named "Principessa Tea) last year in march: at the time the hotel was undergoing a massive restructuring of the rooms and common areas. It was good to come back and see the whole hotel refurbished, beautiful entrance, very good decor in rooms, in ancient 1800's style, the room i got was on the 5th floor, a double single use, a little on the smallish side ( bit that is normal for Rome hotels) with a nice terrace overlooking Rome's roof line, and with a very large bathroom. The Breakfast room, that last timed was a very small back room suring the works, it is now a very elegant appointed area, with a sumptuous complete buffet, including scrambled eggs and bacon. The service ( an item that took to my attention during my previous stay) , is always courteous, efficient and polite, with Marco and his colleague at the reception counter. The price to quality ratio of this hotel is excellent, and I got a very good rate too being low season. The location of this hotel is perfect, near the famous central Via Veneto and the American Embassy, and in 15 minutes walk you are in Via del Corso or in Piazza di Spagna, and just at 50 meters from the hotel there is a very good restaurant, a French Bistro, where we had an excellent dinner last year. I am attaching some pictures taken during my stay there, showing my room, the 545. I strongly recommend this hotel for both tourists and business travelers. It will be a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place To Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Paolo V
Reviews.Content: We stayed in August 2011 and found the hotel very clean and comfortable . We also found the staff were very helpful particularly the young man that worked the evening shifts. The breakfast was outstanding and the location was excellent . If we ever go back to Rome we will certainly be going to this hotel . Thankyou for the wonderful hospitality .

Reviews.Title: “Good price moody staff!”
Reviews.Author: blondemandy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights 21st-23rd jan, Excellent location 10 minutes from centre. Berimini station is a short walk away with 2 stops to termini train station. You can get train from here to the airport. We booked a cab via the hotel cost 50 Eur normally 40 Eur from airport. Normal train and bus trips are 1eur one way. The hotel is ok. Not sure how it got its 4 star rating tho! Breakfast was ok, eggs, Bacon, tosst ceral. Typical breakfast. Rooms ok but no kettle etc. There's a mini bar, beware as there is no price list. We found out that there are very expensive. 5 Eur for a coke-cola. Most of the staff are rude and don't crack a smile. It was trouble for them to answer simple questions! Got free wi-fi booking directly with the hotel, Overall good hotel with good breakfast at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but bad service”
Reviews.Author: Louisecm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here late August 2011 and thought the hotel itself was quite nice and clean. We had read on trip advisor there was quite a lot of renovation but when we arrived we hardly saw any. I think there were only some small areas left that they were fixing. Room - Our room was very nice and had a lovely large bathroom. Everything was very clean and we also had a large TV. No complaints about the room. Location - A bit of a walk to major sights but really not that bad and was lovely to see things along the way. There was also a restaurant located close by called Il Pomodoro (I think that was the name) and it was very good - I would really recommend going there. Breakfast - Yes was fine, had much worse. Service is a bit slow and sometimes they ran out of cups and plates but eventually they get to you. Breakfast finished at 10 (a little early in my opinion) so maybe that's why they were running out of plates by the time we ate. Service - Have to say this was absolutely terrible and why I will not go back despite a very affordable and nicely refurbished hotel. There was an older man at reception who was unbelievably rude. Seemed as though everything I asked him was a bother and almost like he went out of his way to be unhelpful. I would stand at reception and he would not even look up -I had to ask for his attention before he would help. I am not normally bothered by things like that but he really was rude. There were other people we met in the hotel that also found this man rude as well. All in all the hotel itself was fine but the service was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: orik13
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in June-July 2011. Then its name was Principessa Tea. It well located. You can walk to the historic center even with kids (in worst case, you can take a bus). We had a spacy Quadruple room. Hotel was in the mid of reconstruction, but we didn't really feel it. Breakfast was not bad. The staff is very nice and responsive. The only small negative point is that WiFi had very weak signal in our room and was useful only in some corners.

Reviews.Title: “Rome is great!!”
Reviews.Author: Heiko B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 8th December for 4 nights. Lovely hotel, it was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. We were surprised at how big the room was, and at how the hotel was at the really centre of Rome near via Veneto which makes romantic walking around the area. At the reception they were helpful and friendly. He recommended a fantastic italian restaurant nearby, we had a wonderful evening, thank you. Breakfast was nice and plenty of selection, the room was clean and the hotel was always lovely and warm. Nice bar available, which was well stocked, but with several bars within walking distance.                                                                                         Our room was situated at the back of the hotel so we didnt hear any noise at all and slept well, we had free sky and free wifi in room because of the direct booking through their site.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous room, comfortable, breakfast could have been better”
Reviews.Author: ChantalNB
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our two night stay. Comfortable bed, clean room, lovely decor, deep soaker tub. Windows that seal shut to block noise. Location is good, walking distance to many attractions. Only complaint would be on the breakfast - some of the items, such as juice and coffee, appeared to lack freshness on both mornings. The boiled eggs, croissant and yogurt were good.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as we expected.”
Reviews.Author: Moo34
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights, the renovations that have recently been done made it nice looking however our room was a lot smaller then we expected, there was a big open storage area next to our room with matresses, towels etc all just thrown in there. The towel rail is over the bidet and we didn't know if the cloths under the hand basin were hand towels or bidet towels because they were all the same. There was no welcome pack to give us any information about the hotel or services offered, laundry etc. the mini bar was jammed in the cupboard and was hard to open/close, poorly stocked and with no price list or list to fill in what you use. There was also no do not disturb sign to hang on our door. Breakfast was not very good, all really sweet pastries and cold boiled eggs. On the up side the location was not bad and there were some good restaurants on the same street as the hotel. We would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: judsk
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an accessible hotel in Rome, and so it was expected to be, accordung to Agoda.com, But when we arrived (July 2011) the hotel was under construction and we had to climb up about 12 steps, quite an effort for some people... The room was nice, yet you should not expect a great view of the window. It's mainly roofs of the neighbouring buildings. Breakfast was quite dull, served in disposable dishes. The stuff was not very friendly, but the location is good. 5 minutes walk from Via Veneto, 25 minutes from the historic centre, a few minutes from Villa Borghese, a couple of good Italian restuarants minutes away. Yet if the renovations are done it might be a good option, considering the price. Disabled tourists, check with the hotel even if the sight you reserve at mentions the accomodation as one with 'disabled access'.

Reviews.Title: “Was not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: Jermz85
Reviews.Content: As an international travel agent in Australia and having traveled thoroughly throughout the world this hotel is defintly what they rate themselves at as a 4 star I would say more a 3 star seems more appropriate. We arrived to the hotel where we told to walk down an ally way to get to it from the main street then to go around the corner then down some stairs to get to the reception. Check-in was very quick and went through to our room in room 327 rooms have recently Ben refurbished and look wonderful however the view of the dirty corver of the hotel from our balcony was not very pleasant. The hotel can be very noisy every time some flushed the toilet from the rooms above you can hear the water trickling down the pipes behind you :S the hotel receptionist didn't tell us that there were still renovations being done which ment that were woken every morning to the sounds of drill hammers and other noisy equipment going off all around the hotel until about 5pm! If you plan on seeing the sights of do not stay here as it is far from everything I would definetly recommend staying some where more central and not so uphill as it is a killer to walk back up to the hotel in this summer heat and closest hop on and hop off bus is probley a good 20 mins walk away. If you do choose to stay here do not add the breakfast if it is a choice as it isnt very nice and not a wide range if offered, a couple of cerials with some codial mix and warm milk, a couple of ranges of ham and cheese and a couple of hot dishes :( o would recommentpd to go have brekky at one of the many great cafes and restaurants down the road! I am currently staying at the hotel now as it has all been prepaid but if I had the money to check in to another hotel I would've left by now.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice......”
Reviews.Author: molaz
Reviews.Content: Just two words about this hotel... First, it was renstructured a few wekks before our arrival, and the new strutcure it's very good. Location is just two steps to Via Veneto, and it's easy to reach Piazza di Spagna and Fontana di Trevi by steps without taking bus or other. At 1 km from hotel there is the metro station "Barberini" where is possible to take metro for all destination, railway station "Termini" included (two stop). The rooms are very good and quiets, clens and confortings. Me and my wife stayed in room 217. hotel people has been very gentle and they was available to solve all problems or suggest information about the places of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ersan2000
Reviews.Content: As I understood, the new name of the hotel is Principessa Isabella. We arrived there on the 11th of August. The hotel private car met us at the airport. We were four people and paid 50 Euros for the service. Actually taxi is 40 Euros but it is a good service. The hotel was prettier than we thought. It is about 15 minutes to the Barberi metro station (which is a very nice area) and 5 minutes walking to the bus stop. The entrance is very nice with a small fountain. The lobi is nice and big enough. The 3 receptionists are helpfull and friendly and polite. The rooms are big enough and the air condition is perfect. There is a safe in the rooms.The breakfast is good enough, you can find bacon and egg, cheese, salami, butter, jam, honey, croissant, We stayed for a week and had no problem at all. The only thing we did not expect was to pay 3 Euros per person, per day as a city tax. One more thing internet is not free you have to pay 2 Euros per hour. You will like the hotel... cakes, corn flakes etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and excellent bed!”
Reviews.Author: paula0607
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by an english speaking receptionist who was lovely. Our room was a good size, very very clean and new. Double king size memory foam bed. Chandelier!!! Breakfast was small and the same each day but that was no bad thing. Juice, pastries, egg and ham, selection of cheese and meat, yoghurts, breads. The hotel is easily within walking reach of the Spanish steps. A downhill walk will take you to Berberini metro station. The metro is 1 euro for a trip, very cheap!! There is a Spar nearby for drinks and snacks. There was also a fridge in the room which was handy as Rome is unbearably ho tin August. The air con in our room was tremendous and the windows were double glazed and shuttered. No noise and no heat coming through those! In Rome drinks are quite expensive (like London prices), you must fill your water bottle up at the numerous water fountains and drink plenty. The water is clean and cool.

Reviews.Title: “now called Principessa Isabella”
Reviews.Author: shoptiludrop1
Reviews.Content: Undergoing renovations so the lobby is none existent, stairs from the street level to the reception is very rickety and they dont help with your luggage. Place is very dusty due to renovations which they didnt disclose when we booked this hotel. There is no restaurant in the hotel, only a small room with tables for breakfast. Breakfast is buffett from 7am, no hot food but a selection of continental pastries. We had to leave early to do a tour and reception refused to provide a breakfast take away, despite our breakfast being paid for. Wifi is not free. The hotel is quite far from the town centre so be prepared to walk! Room is clean and been freshly re-done. No tea/coffee making facilities, no ironing board. TV has cable and you are able to switch language to English which i great! Not sure why they are rated as 4-star, maybe more like 3 star only.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: prof_dumbledore
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 week with my girlfriend. the staff is nice and helpful. the location is excellent. 10 minutes walk to the spanish steps, 5 minutes to metro. the building is an old one. but hey, this is rome right? they are supposed to be old. the rooms are clean and the room service is good. the guy with the beard at the reception insists on talking italian although he can speak english. this is nice too somehow, at least he forces you to learn some useful words. the price is reasonable compared to the other choices in the same area. i enjoyed my stay in this hotel, and i would definitely stay again if i had the chance to.

Reviews.Title: “Not great...wouldn't stay again.”
Reviews.Author: minimomBelAir
Reviews.Content: Situated off the beaten path, the hotel is not impressive, even though they are renovating the guest rooms. The stairs leading to the lobby are covered in blue ripped carpeting and the lobby needs a lot of work. The same can be said for the breakfast room. Breakfast was just OK. The rooms are extremely small with extremely uncomfortable beds and the pillows are a joke. I didn't sleep the entire time we were there. Can't say I would ever stay again. Didn't really like the area where the hotel is...would have preferred to be a little closer to a metro station in a much nicer hotel. Not a four-star hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here until elevator is completed!”
Reviews.Author: Scorpion74
Reviews.Content: We booked and prepaid months in advance and wish we had been told that the hotel was under reconstruction. With no elevator i was very limited in getting in and out each day due to a busted up ankle a while back. Being on an upper floor made going out and coming back at the end of the day quite stressful. The only reason we didn't complain to staff was because the American family in front of us did enough complaining for the entire complement of guests. The room we stayed in had been renovated and was absolutely gorgeous, done out in a Roman theme, beautiful furnishings and painted walls and ceiling. Very comfortable bed and was lovely to have windows open and curtains billowing and the bathroom was very nice. HOWEVER... breakfast was a complete nightmare, i thought i was in a Fawlty Towers episode. It is imperative that during the renovations the dining area is completely overhauled. Dirty, ugly room, untidy, mismatched furniture, crockery and cutlery, stale bread, cordial, cheap coffee, and something that is not cornflakes! Definitely not 4 star breakfast, definitely not 4 star entry/reception area, definitely not 4 star facilities... only the lovely room made up for this. Day staff polite and friendly, night man very unhelpful and rude. Nice walk about 5 blocks to Via Veneto and lovely eating areas. If i was going to stay again would closely check Trip Advisor and view the latest reviews first.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: dee_elle2011
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here for 4 days in May 2011 - and loved it! The hotel is located on a quiet street with many good restaurants and around the corner from a bus route. Piazza Barberini Metro station is a 10 minute walk down a really nice broad boulevard. There is a small grocery store around the corner where we picked up wine, water and a few snacks. The hotel is in the process of being renovated, the floor we stayed on had already been renovated and looked amazing. Nice marble floors and a comfortable bed and great modern bathroom. The only negative for us was that the elevator was under construction so we had to walk up and down 5 flights of stairs every day. I believe the elevator has since been restored. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable and very willing to carry our heavy bags up and down from the room. Breakfast was good, lots of cereal, yogurt, bread and cold cuts to choose from as well as juices, milk and coffee. I would definitely recommend this hotel, especially for families as the location is very quiet and close to the Borghesi Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Value Hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: William055
Reviews.Content: This was offered as a 4 star hotel....with Bar, and a Piano bar, with breakfast and all day snacks and drinks etc. We arrived to find a new lift being installed (this was never mentioned when booking)..we had to climb four floors of steps to our room ( My wife has a heart condition and was very distressed)..they moved us down to the 3rd floor...the best they could do..big deal. We had arranged to meet family from Australia in the bar...alas there was no bar....and certainly no piano bar. The breakfast was very average..withn no fruit and the cereal bowls were a mixture non matching crockery and plastic...the cutlery was of the same low standard...the room is in need of a massive facelift. This Hotel is not representative of a 4 star hotel...it need visiting by officials and regrading asap...it was the worst possible value for money you could imagine.

Reviews.Title: “WE WILL NOT GO BACK”
Reviews.Author: burmesemimi
Reviews.Content: Lots of work being done on hotel. Currently very tired looking facilities. Staff unhelpful. Refused our request for cups and a little milk so we could make a hot drink. My friend had an accident and we wanted to make her a drink using our own provissions, the night receptionist was very rude to us and refused at first lengthy pleas later he eventually relented. The lift unavailable for first two days. workmen continuing to work on it when we left boxing it in safely etc when we left. Dining room was like 1950's boarding house small, hard to negotiate round the tables. One hot drinks dispenser, one very slow toaster which holds things up when several guests want to use it. The safe in our room did not work. Bedroom was ok bathroom very nice. Quiet location though in business district. good walk to reach tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “A disaster”
Reviews.Author: faisalsmom
Reviews.Content: Why would I want to stay there again, if I have to carry my suitcase to the 6. floor while the elevator is under construction? No staff, that was inclined to help at any time. Service attitude is unknown in this hotel. In addition the telephone wasn't working so for every little thing I had to walk down six floors to again face the unhelpful front office employees. Garbage was dumped in front of my bedroom door, so overall an experience that I do not recommend to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “a nice hotel..”
Reviews.Author: countrerz
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel 3 nights good beds, nice breakfast, good service, very clean i really loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great for everything!”
Reviews.Author: King_1338
Reviews.Content: Just few words: excellent staff, great location, breakfast abundant and rooms breathtaking! Of course I recommend it: just do it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Room and bath updated, staff and reception needs updating!”
Reviews.Author: mainerkbk
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed to at Principessa Tea Hotel with my son (21) and sister-in-law. We booked a triple room for 5 nights, The room and bath were very nicely decorated, however, the third bed was a pull out couch, This was not mentioned. On the first night I asked for an extra chair so we could all have a seat in the room (as opposed to opening and closing "the bed"). I was told this was not possible. Asked for a plastic cup (as one of the three provided had a hole), again, not possible! When asked about local places to go, the staff just pointed to the touristy brochures on the counter. I did find that after our 4th day, the front staff was a bit more helpful. Ask direct questions! I found the breakfast staff great and very helpful, again you need to ask and not be intimidated (with the American thing!). They are in the process of redoing the front reception, helpful hint, some nice comfortable chairs and sitting area would be nice, as the room we had did not accommodate the three of us for anything but sleeping. The location is fine. Wander away from the Via Venato and toward Via Pieve and you'll find a less touristy area. If you are a walker you can get anywhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Charming stay”
Reviews.Author: Podganka
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend had a very good stay in this hotel, staff was excellent, very helpfull and friendly, the room was spacious and quite clean, breakfast was not rich, but totally ok for this price. Great location to see all atttractions by foot (15 min to Spanish steps). You have a lot of restaurants near by, but avoid pizzerias on this street. We ate most terrible pizza there in our life:)

Reviews.Title: “Delightful, charming. clean and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: GizmoSprocket
Reviews.Content: We loved the room so much. We loved the charm of the ceiling and the chandelier. The bed was extremely comfortable, not soft but not to hard. The man at the front desk called a local restaurant that had excellent food and great service to arrange for food for us, as we had arrived between lunch and dinner. He spoke excellent English. It was a bit of a walk to the heavy tourist area, but totally worth it. It was in a very quiet neighborhood, great cafe just a block away and the hotel was located very close to Villa Borghese. It took maybe 7-8 minutes to get to the metro and action and was so worth it to stay in a more quiet area with beautiful mansions all around it. Close to Trevi Fountain, close to Spanish Steps. And we took the Metro to the Vatican, which was very easy to do. They did serve a nice breakfast but didn't have a restaurant that served lunch or dinner, but plenty of places to eat in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A chair for sitting”
Reviews.Author: barbante
Reviews.Content: Stairs up to reception fairly steep with no help. Reception staff friendly and helpful. Good English. Continental breakfast good especially the hard boiled eggs. Kitchen staff very helpful. Bed good but extra pillows would be good. Bathroom new and best part. Room got very warm at night. No where to sit in room or in reception. Lots of restaurants close by. Elevator. Wi Fi cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel a little further away”
Reviews.Author: chrispigirl
Reviews.Content: First off, this hotel is a little further away from the main sites in Rome, but is right next to the park. We thought it was nice (and less expensive) to be away from the main tourist area. We were disappointed at first because we had booked the hotel for three nights and when we arrived, they said the room was not ready and sent us to a HORRIBLE hotel for one night. Supposedly some guests had come back drunk the night before and refused to check out. When we finally received a room there, they gave us a suite with two bedrooms (which we did not need). But, it was very nice. The bathroom was nice too.

Reviews.Title: “we loved your hotel, we will go back”
Reviews.Author: help042
Reviews.Content: the only thing we found is that it was not very close to the sights, but we walked and took buses and taxis and we found everything!!

Reviews.Title: “OMG - THIS is our hotel?! How is THIS a 4 star?!”
Reviews.Author: Chrissy04NZ
Reviews.Content: The staff were REALLY nice, the room had air conditioning but that’s they are the best parts. The breakfast was so bad, we ended up skipping breakfast because the buns were stale and hard – no matter how much butter you put on then, they still tasted like crap! This was a major issue considering I don’t function properly without breakfast and my husband couldn’t even drink the coffee! The paint on the ceiling was peeling off, there were missing tiles on the floors which they tried to cover up with a mat. The shower was over the bath (which I don’t mind) but the shower had a removable shower head (which I usually like) but the holder for the shower head wasn’t big enough so it fell down all the time! It was frustrating to say the least. Not to mention the bath was SO tiny that when you did have a shower, the whole bathroom got a wash and you couldn’t do anything to prevent that! The bed was so uncomfortable, we tried make it more comfortable by packing the mattress with blankets – which still didn’t help. Also, the walls were paper thin so you could hear everything. When you went out for the day, you had to leave your key at the reception – you weren’t allowed to keep them with you – which was very strange. We were both extremely disappointed to say the least and would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beat expectations!”
Reviews.Author: divin1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Tea for four nights in September, 2010. First for three nights and then again one more night at a separate stay. We were very pleased with the quality and size of our room(s) both times. We expected them to be smaller so were happy when we discovered a foyer with small couch in our first room (#216) and a very large room with a full size couch and a huge terrace in our second room (#546). Both rooms were elegantly furnished and very clean with air conditioning and flat screen TV's. We found Rocco on the day shift and Mauro on the evening shift at reception to both be very pleasant and helpful. The hotel is very close to Borghesse Gardens, Harry's Bar and walking distance to the Spanish Steps, Trevi fountain, Piazza Navona, etc. Try the hop-on/hop-off bus which you can pick up at Barberini Plaza, a 10 min. walk from the hotel. The double decker bus takes you all over the city for the best sites and includes an audio guide. All in all, the Hotel Tea meet and even beat our expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: sash_romanov
Reviews.Content: We were at the Hotel relaxing and then sightseeing Rome. Hotel is really ok. Comfort and quietness. Renewed rooms. Good service. They advice us where to go and what to see. At the reception they spoke Russian, our mother tongue. We felt like home. Everything is near, we felt like in the famous movie Dolce Vida. Plaze de Espagna, Via Veneto, Trevi fountain, you can walk there in 15 minutes. By cab is maybe 2-3 minutes. They suggest us shops and restaurants. All the good shops are near, too. They send us to delicious restaurants. We have been to one fish restaurant called Grillo or something like that. High quality food and very high class service. It was very expensive but it worted. They also suggest Esquisito. Terrible place. Not to recommend. Expensive and bad food. My wife puked all night. We had to leave early in the morning so we could not complain with the reception. Please and do not send there guests. However, our stay at Hotel was good.

Reviews.Title: “So-so experience!!”
Reviews.Author: beebahk
Reviews.Content: The initial impression was good and the receptionist was friendly. But it was down hill from there. It was in early July and we kept losing eletrcity in the middle of the night and we had to step out to the hallway to turn the power back on. Several times a night that way. The rooms were not exactly pristine either and the bathroom was in worse shape than the one I used to use in the colege dorm! The front desk was quite rude regarding breakfast, refusing us to have breakfast even just 5 minutes before it was meant to begin. I didn't realize they could be so meticulous about time, almost to the minute. As for location, it was okay, although it was always a walk to get to the texi stop or the Metro stop. The walk on Via Venezia was pleasant enough, so at least that we didn't mind. But I would certainly stay elsewhere next time i go to Rome. If i want convenience, I would even stay at those neat the train station (Termini) for even less price.

Reviews.Title: “great location, wonderful staff, beautiful remodelled rooms”
Reviews.Author: grapenut614
Reviews.Content: great location... walking distance to Trevi Fountain and Spanish steps and Via Veneto. The staff were very helpful and friendly (ESPECIALLY MAURO in the in evenings)!!! Good breakfast every morning. We appreciated the safe and minifridge in the room and the wifi! The recently remodelled rooms were lovely. We would definitely stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Clean & comfortable place with a cozy setup.”
Reviews.Author: yy_yeoh
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband spend 2 nights in Rome and stayed in this hotel. The price is is slightly high for a budget stay, but the hotel is clean and nicely done. It is around 20-25 minutes walk to the famous Trevi fountain and a 10 min walk to the bus stations. Thus, it's very convenient if you are taking public transport. The staff is friendly and help to point us the directions the the few major places of interest. Will definitely consider returning to Hotel Tea if we are visiting Rome again! :)

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: lmandm
Reviews.Content: If you are used to european hotels, this place will make you happy! While the rooms are small compared to American hotels, for a European hotel, it really was a great choice! We were there in a quadruple with our two teenaged kids and thought it worked well for us. Excellent location - the staff were wonderful and the bathroom was really super! The lovation was also good - walking distance to many nice restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the rooms at reception”
Reviews.Author: Hen21London
Reviews.Content: This is like a Jekyll & Hyde hotel - the rooms on the upper floors are lovely, but the rooms directly behind reception are grim. The room I stayed in the first night felt damp, was much in need of redecoration, very very shabby, although will emphasize it was clean and you could hear every coming and going in reception. I felt they were being opportunistic as I was a solo traveller, when I requested a room move they agreed without hesitation for the next day, The next morning I heard someone else complain from the room next door. I appreciate renovation takes time, but they should make it clear, I travel a lot and can say that these "downstairs"rooms are the worse have ever been offered. As I say once moved, the room was lovely, the hotel staff were charming, but a room upstairs in the first place would have been a lot more appreciated than charm!

Reviews.Title: “With some work, this hotel could become above average.”
Reviews.Author: Niclaus27
Reviews.Content: What follows is a review of my week-long stay at this small hotel, which may seem harsh to some (especially the owners of this property), however, being as objective as possible, future guests should have full disclosure and not believe pictures on websites. Speaking of pictures. Those that are on this property's website are inviting. They show well-appointed rooms that appear spacious. I was disappointed at the size of the rooms upon check-in; they did not live up to the expansiveness that the website photos indicate. Although meticulously clean and freshly renovated, they are typical European rooms. That is, small and lacking the move-around space that is common in American fare hotels. The bathroom was also newly refurbished, however, the large sink size and its close proximity to the toilet bowl made it very difficult to sit without hitting yourself as you attempt to wiggle through the available space to get to the toilet. Large (or tall) guests will find this particularly difficult and I would recommend anyone who is packing a few extra pounds to avoid this property. I have to say the rooms were clean and free of any musty smell (or that of a recent smoker). Certainly, this room did not violate any of my clean-freak idiosyncrasies. My problems with this property are many. After lengthy conversation with some of the very helpful staff, I learned that a major expansion of the lobby is underway, which should alleviate the following points I would like to share. Of course, until these changes are actually made, I would render this hotel toward the bottom of my future choices, perhaps slightly above that of a pensione. 1. There was only one chair in the lobby, making it impossible to use the cramped quarters as a meeting place for groups traveling together. Similarly, upon check-in, bags clutter what space is available, adding to the claustrophobic feeling. 2. Although the lobby had Wi-Fi capability, the fact there was only one chair on which to sit made it impossible for two people to use their computer at the same time, unless, of course, one of the guests sat on the lobby floor. 3. The rooms did not have internet access. (Perhaps the lobby expansion will include a few computers that the guests could "rent" on an hourly basis.) 4. The entrance to the hotel was at street level, however, you had to traverse two flights of steps (approx 12 in number) with your bags to get to the check-in desk. At our arrival time, there was no hotel staff available to assist guests in moving their luggage, which meant we all had to carry our baggage to the rooms. 5. Since we were traveling as a group, we were given our own "floor" of rooms - the 6th floor, to be exact. The very small elevator only stops to the 5th floor. So, to get our bags to our rooms, we had to traverse another series of steps. 6. The breakfast room was ample for the amount of guests this property accomodates, however, it is only accessible via the elevator, as it is located on the "ground-level" of the hotel. A stairway leading to the breakfast room would improve access, as well as an emergency exit. 7. The elevator was noisy. Even though the elevator did not stop on our floor, it could still be heard quite loudly, especially at night.

Reviews.Title: “Shafty, misleading, & unpleasant service.”
Reviews.Author: DonatingDonkey
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel, service, breakfast, location etc... was quite good and warrants a strong rating. ie 8/10 (Very good). However a massive attempt to provide us with a room unlike the one we had paid for makes us give this hotel a rating of 0/10. (Very very poor) In brief upon arrival we were shown two downstairs rooms (rooms 103, & 102) that were completely in a different class to the advertised rooms that we had payed for. The rooms we were initially tricked to staying in were very poor even though the man at reception new very well that there were much better rooms available on the the higher floors. The rooms i'm referring to are all in the standard category. It was only after challenging the man at reception that he succomb and checked us in to a proper room. The man at reception came across as very sly, cheap and cheasy. Every culture has it's own personality however the service provided on this occassion was terrible by any cultures standards. I strongly advise before paying you inspect your room or email the hotel with and ask for a reply email with pictures of the room you are paying for. Take this email with as evidence when you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice bathrooms, beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: 7Tarheels
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for 3 nights, in 2 rooms. We had identical rooms on different floors. The bathrooms were some of the nicest I have seen in Europe. The rooms seemed to be newly decorated with a chandelier over the bed and nice paint on the walls. There was a very noisy group that kept us awake one night, but this was not the fault of the hotel. Mauro at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. I got to talk with him a bit because the internet is only available in the lobby where there is only 1 chair, which was a bit annoying. Some of my young adult children went down to use the internet at the same time and sat on the floor (as there is only 1 chair) and they were asked to not sit there. The breakfast room is dreary and the breakfast quite poor. One of my children cannot eat gluten or eggs, so had nothing to eat, although another child was delighted to find hard-boiled eggs on the table. I think the hotel plans to renovate this area in the future. Hopefully the breakfast will improve. Overall, the nice staff and rooms definitely made this a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room and Bath”
Reviews.Author: Wolfe67
Reviews.Content: My 13-year-old son and I stayed there on vacation. The room and bath were exquisite, quite beyond my expectations. The service at the front desk was friendly and helpful. The breakfast room in the basement was absolutely dismal, and the food itself was dreadful, including spoiled milk. Fortunately, there are plenty of cafes nearby to get a quick breakfast before sightseeing. The location was not ideal for visiting ancient Rome, but was close enough to the subway and bus lines to still be convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Schreckliche Erfahrung mit Empfangspersonal - horrible experience with the reception”
Reviews.Author: Ashley_vM
Reviews.Content: Very bad experience with the hotel personnel, to say exactly, a man around 40 years old who can speak English at the reception. My parents (around 70 years old) only can speak a little English, no Italien. At check-in they did the payment in cash, but they did not get a receipt or something. I called the hotel from Germany, this man said only at check-out they can get a bill. But I asked whithout any receipt how my parents can prove if they've already paid . So he finally gave them a receipt. During the phone talk, he did not have a bit patience, saying "I have just told you, you did not listen". Well, even if I did not listen or understand, maybe he can repeat once instead of criticising me. After they came back from Italy 7 days later, I asked them if they have an bill, no, they did not get. I called the hotel again. This man said on the phone: "I gave it to them personally, they are lying" and hang up the phone. I was so shocked how he can judge somebody lying before he knew the truth. On the other hand, one should never talk like this to the customer! I called again to tell they did not get, he said he gave it the first day. I said that's just a receipt with handwriting, not bill. He said, they don't provide computer printed bill, only handwriting receipt. Then he told me he is fed up of my invoice problem. I'm really horrified how far he can go. He hang up the phone and did not pick it up anymore when I tried to call. Later I manage to go through the line and wanted to talk to his manager, he just hang up. That's a horrible experience. One can really cry if he/she faces such service person. In conclusion: 1, the person doesn't have an idea what service is. He can criticise or abuse customer as he likes. Very bad manner, no patience, bad and short temper. He is definitely not qualified to work at the front desk. 2, this hotel is trying to evade tax, otherwise one cannot understand why they don't give a bill. My parents saw another couple was arguing 20 minutes at the check-out. They suppose the same problem with a bill. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Just do it!”
Reviews.Author: kitsakala
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, big room with a great big bathroom. (We stayed in the first floor). Really close to Piazza Barberini, only one bus stop. Quiet place, a little dark in the night but you have nothing to be afraid of. Mauro in the front door was very friendly and made as feel home! He gave as all the answers for transports, dinning, bars etc. Breakfast was ok..basic but enough for a good start in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful surprise”
Reviews.Author: UsaNeill
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the lobby and reception area. The upper floors have been totally renovated. The rooms are exquisite. Chandeliers, a/c that works very well, marble, flat-screen TVs, oil painting over the bed. Bathrooms have been totally re-done and updated. The staff at the reception desk were extremely helpful regarding luggage storage, guide to area restaurants. There is a very upscale restaurant one block over as you leave the hotel to the left. Several other restaurants in the block. Very close to the huge park. Walking distance to the Via Veneto with every kind of restaurant that you would want. Metro station at the end of the Via Veneto. Nice, quiet neighborhood. I highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Don't plan on staying in the hotel too much...”
Reviews.Author: jdev0609
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for something cheap, and aren't expecting too much, then this is a fine place to stay. It wasn't dirty, no bugs. The staff was friendly and helpful. The included breakfast was fine (about the same as we got everywhere else). Pros: It was a short walk to the metro (either Spagna or Barberini), and very close to Villa Borghese (which I highly recommend) and the Spanish Steps. There is also a great gelato place up the street (towards Via Veneto). Cons: The "golden era" of this area was in the 60's (along the Via Vittorio Veneto), and I don't think the hotel was updated since then. Its quiet in the area now, and we were surprised with how early things seemed to close. The rooms are small and outdated. The bathroom was the worst of any hotel we stayed at in italy.

Reviews.Title: “Five star rooms in a 3 star hotel....if you get the newly renovated ones!”
Reviews.Author: Showmeamountain
Reviews.Content: Myself, my husband and another couple went to Rome for the weekend. My friend organised all the travel and hotel arrangements. She showed my husband and I the website before we travelled and we were very pleased with the visuals of the rooms etc. I did notice on the trip advisor site that someone had posted some photos of the hotel rooms looking very old and shabby but was relieved when I read on further that the hotel was in the middle of a refurbishment and would be finished by end of June 2009. On arrival we were greeted very nicely and given the keys to our rooms on the same floor as the reception. I was slightly alarmed at the state of the door to our room as I couldnt imagine why a hotel would renovate all the rooms but not change the doors. Anyway, my horror was to get worse on entry. The room was disgusting to say the least. It was smelly, damp, 1960's bed covers, mouldy walls, no plugs, safe in a trolley on wheels....etc etc ,it goes on. My husband was very unimpressed and when we got back from dinner nearby and he really couldnt have a bath as there was no plug, I decided to have a little look upstairs. To my utter amazement it was like walking from a nightmare into a princess dream castle. The walls, corridoors and hotel room doors were renovated to a very impressive standard and looked 5 star. I could not believe we had been given what was obviously the last of the "rubbish" rooms downstairs. I dragged my husband to have a look and he was as shocked as me. He stomped off to reception and asked for us and our friends to be moved. Amazingly the receptionist wasnt put out at all, as if this must happen all the time. He said it was too late that night but to speak to the manager in the morning. We did that and he immediately said he would move us up to the superior rooms that day. As good as his word, when we got back that night we were upstairs and the difference was absolutely unbelievable. The rooms were fantastic. Not overly large but incredibly clean, comfortable, light, airy. They were the sort of hotel room I would seek to stay in. We had two very enjoyable nights there. The downstairs area/reception and breakfast room I understand are the next phase to be done. Once this has been completed this hotel will be hard to beat. Just make sure you get a new refurbished room otherwise you will be so disappointed you booked this hotel. Now having stayed there initially in a bad "old" room, I can understand why some reviews of this hotel are so awful. It is a real shame because these negative opinions are obviously only coming from the guests they are placing in the old rooms. If they had any sense they would close them down to visitors now as a bad reputation is very hard to get rid of. They should fill the beautiful new rooms only and I guarantee all the visitors from now onwards will be absolutely delighted to be there. We will definately stay at the Tea Hotel again when we next visit the wonderful Rome.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING! Do Not stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tomato_Sorce
Reviews.Content: I booked a night at this hotel and was informed that the airconditioning was broken. The man - Roberto was so rude. He told me that because I was only staying one night I should put up with it. I tried to highlight to him that regardless of what he felt, I wanted what I had booked. Because of his arrogance and rudeness I went and stayed somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “good value for the area”
Reviews.Author: josiePlymouth
Reviews.Content: We just arrived back from Rome, Italy and had a great time even though our money doesn't go very far. The Principessa tea hotel was a good value. It was located near the via veneto. the hotel is in the process of being done over and we were pleasantly surprised by the rooms. they started the renovations from the top floor down, so the lobby isn't done yet. The hotel has done a great job of renovation. tile everywhere and clean bathrooms with all new fixtures. the Rooms were a little small but we had enough room. Room 545 had a large closet , and a great balcony(no chairs). The only complaint we had with the hotel was that the air conditioner was not on. they don't put it on until mid june. huh? Room was a little hot, had to keep the balcony door open all night. We had gone to Rome for a wedding and a little sight seeing. all in all a great time

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: totalTrondheim
Reviews.Content: I've read many reviews of this hotel before we headed for Rome. The hotel was prepaid, so there was impossible to change. A certain amount of the reviews was VERY bad, and we were excited when we wntered the hotel 10 pm at March 29th. But alas - everything was just perfect: a nice room (newly renovated) with a comfortable bed, a very clean and modern bathroom, and a safe in the closet. The location was also perfect, just some few minutes form hte Borghese Park and Museum. Even if it was in the center of the town, the nights were very quiet, and there were lots of restaurants in all prce ranges in the neighboorhood. It's beyond our imagination that this hotel was a bad one. We stayed 6 days in Ancona (Eastern Italy, Adriatic coast), and there we paid the same price, but in Ancona we stayed far from the center, it was a motel, and it was a really low budget accomodation without a low budget price! The room we stayed in, looked just like the photos on the internet site. The staff was mainly friendly and helpful. The breakfast assortment wasn't very plentiful, but OK. Daytime we heard the renovation of the 2nd and 3rd floors, but when you are in Rome, you don't stay in your hotel room at daytime?? So, we will certainly stay in this hotel next time we are in Rome, and will recommend this to others!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfortable, ideally located, excellent service and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: orswelle
Reviews.Content: The place was really a pleasant surprise and can't say enough good things about it. Maybe the best hotel I've ever stayed at. Made you feel right at home with really laid-back but at the same time professional staff. Really friendly people. The location was perfect because although it was totally right in the downtown, it wasn't an area loaded with tourists so we felt like we're really a part of the city's life instead of just tourists. It's elegance lent itself very well also to being romantic enough for a couple like us. All this with reasonable prices too. When going back to Rome won't even consider another hotel. Would recommend it to anyone. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “One horrific experience”
Reviews.Author: San_DiegoJoan
Reviews.Content: Night # 1 -When we arrived we were told they could not honor our reservation, so they sent us to a nearby hotel for the same price. Our room was on an incredibly busy street so the noise level all night kept us awake (we equated it with a Boeing 747 driving up and down the street.) Night #2 - Back at Principessa in the a.m. with our bags. We were told our room was not ready, but go enjoy our day and they would put the bags in our room for our return in the evening. We got back to the hotel about 10:00 p.m. only to find our bags still in the lobby. There was no one to help us with our bags - not for us, but for the other couple we were traveling with - aged 70 years old. Our room was so small we had to move the portable heater out in order to put our bags inside the room. The bed was two single beds pushed together with a large sheet to hold them together. The furnishing were so old that the veneer was peeling off the furniture. The bath as clean but with rust stains on the sink, etc. They promised to move us for night #3 to a newly remodeled room. Night #3. The remodeled room was GORGEOUS. So, after two sleepness nights we were looking forward to a great night's sleep in this really lovely room. NOT. The bed was stone hard - not an ounce of give to the mattress at all. In fairness, it's tough to find a hotel in Rome for less than $200/night. I would say that if by now all the rooms have been remodeled, then take a chance - if you don't mind sleeping on a slab!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Principessa Isabella
HotelInfo.Address: Via Sardegna 149, 00187 Rome, Italy
